comments.body: @tansongyang the addition of the `TMetaPayload` argument to the `Action` generic and the intersection typing of `ActionMeta` and `TMetaPayload` on this line (along with @quicksnap's new `PackActionPayload` and `MetaPayload` typings) seem to correctly solve the original use case of passing custom metadata keys through to the reducer, as evidenced by the tests (without adding the key signature to the `ActionMeta` type def as I originally did). This seems like the safer and better solution.

`TFullState` was originally a param of the `handle` generic, but as it was only used once in the def, the TSLint rule (no-unnecessary-generics) forced me to define it like this, which I don't think should be a problem as it allows for an obj of any shape.
We should increment the version here to `0.2`.
